intro: Sida macrodon var. cymbalaria, commonly known as the common sida, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the warmer regions of the Americas. It features alternate, ovate to lance-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that dehisce to release tiny seeds. Sida macrodon var. cymbalaria is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, showing adaptability to various environmental conditions.
